data.enText: to make sth known to sb

data.chText: 地方报纸披露了谋杀的细节。
data.enText: Details of the murder were revealed by the local paper.

data.chText: 报告显示，公司去年亏损2 000万英镑。
data.enText: The report reveals (that) the company made a loss of £20 million last year.

data.chText: 据透露，重要的证据被隐瞒了。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语 (+ that从句)

data.enText: It was revealed that important evidence had been suppressed.

data.chText: 警察们不能透露他的死因。
data.enText: Officers could not reveal how he died.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: to show sth that previously could not be seen

data.chText: 他笑了起来，露出一排洁白的牙齿。
data.enText: He laughed, revealing a line of white teeth.

data.chText: 房门打开，一间温暖舒适的小屋展现在眼前。
data.enText: The door opened to reveal a cosy little room.

data.chText: 她蜷缩在黑暗中，吓得不敢露面。
data.enText: She crouched in the dark, too frightened to reveal herself .

simple_means.memory_skill: re 相反；反对；不 + veal〔= veil〕盖上 → 不盖上 → 揭露

ex.chText: 他向公司的竞争对手泄露了重要信息。
ex.enText: He disclosed important information to the rival of his company.

ex.chText: 他拒绝透露其收入来源。
ex.enText: He refused to disclose the source of his income.

synonyms.bx: 公开某事，尤指不为人知的或被隐瞒的事。

ex.chText: 秘书试图揭穿那个阴谋。
ex.enText: The secretary tried to expose the plot.

ex.chText: 该报道揭露了现有运输系统的不足之处。
ex.enText: The report exposes the disadvantages of the present transportation system.

ex.chText: 那名年轻的记者揭露了这位首席执行官的丑事。
ex.enText: That young reporter exposed the abuses of the CEO.

synonyms.bx: 尤指揭露丑闻、阴谋等不好的事。

ex.chText: 她绝不会泄露朋友的秘密。
ex.enText: She will never reveal/disclose her friends' secrets.

ex.chText: 一家地方报纸披露了谋杀的细节。
ex.enText: Details of the murder were revealed/disclosed by a local newspaper.

synonyms.bx: 指揭露此前不为人知或隐秘的事，常可与 disclose 换用。

tr: make known to the public information that was previously known only to a few people or that was meant to be kept a secret
example: The auction house would not disclose the price at which the van Gogh had sold
The actress won't reveal how old she is
he broke the news to her
unwrap the evidence in the murder case
He brings out the best in her
God rarely reveal his plans for Mankind

value.def: To reveal something means to make people aware of it.

example.ex: She has refused to reveal the whereabouts of her daughter...
example.tran: 她不肯透露她女儿的行踪。

example.ex: A survey of the British diet has revealed that a growing number of people are overweight...
example.tran: 对英国人饮食进行的一项调查显示有越来越多的人超重。

example.ex: After the fire, it was revealed that North Carolina officials had never inspected the factory...
example.tran: 大火过后人们发现北卡罗来纳州的官员从没对这家工厂进行过检查。

example.ex: No test will reveal how much of the drug was taken.
example.tran: 没有哪项测试可以测出用药量。

value.def: If you reveal something that has been out of sight, you uncover it so that people can see it.

example.ex: A grey carpet was removed to reveal the original pine floor.
example.tran: 一块灰色的地毯被揭开，露出了原来的松木地板。

trans: 显示全部；显示所有；全部显示；顯示全部

partsOfSpeech.dec: re 相反；反对；不 + veal〔= veil〕盖上 → 不盖上 → 揭露
un 打开 + veil 盖上 → 揭开面纱 → 揭露
